intro: Narcissus eugeniae, commonly known as the Spanish daffodil, is a species of flowering plant in the Amaryllidaceae family. It is native to the Iberian Peninsula and is characterized by its striking yellow flowers with a white throat. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and produces narrow, grass-like leaves. Its blooms appear in late winter to early spring, making it one of the earliest flowering bulbs in the region. The flowers are pollinated primarily by bees and have a distinctive, sweet fragrance.
